arts.ttl: The lowdown on Charlton 1 Shrewsbury Town 0 - Lloyd Jones’ impressive stats as Small makes big contribution
arts.sum: Charlton: Maynard-Brewer, Small, Gillesphey, Jones, A Mitchell (Ramsay 75), Edwards, Coventry, Docherty (Godden 74), Berry (Anderson 74, T Campbell, Leaburn (Aneke 63). Because the next moment there was a chance for Small at the other end of the pitch and he swept it convincingly home to spark mass celebrations, the Charlton bench flooding on to the pitch.

arts.ttl: Kayne Ramsay boosts Charlton Athletic selection options after injury return
arts.sum: Kayne Ramsay ended a three-month spell on the sidelines with a late substitute appearance for Charlton Athletic today – with assistant boss Curtis Fleming describing his return as feeling “like a new signing”. Those hard days he had when we were training and he was running around by himself – those horrible days getting pummeled and we’re just playing five a sides.

arts.ttl: Thierry Small earns Charlton last-gasp win over Shrewsbury
arts.sum: Small scored moments after Jordan Shipley missed a golden chance for the Shrews.

arts.ttl: Charlton's mixed injury fortunes ahead of Shrewsbury Town clash
arts.sum: Ramsay has made 11 League One appearances this season, 10 from the start for Jones' side, but he picked up a knee injury in the game against Stockport County at The Valley in the middle of October. "It’s a Gareth Ainsworth side so they’ll be well up for it," he said.

arts.ttl: Charlton Athletic boss ‘very confident’ of defender agreeing new deal
arts.sum: Charlton Athletic manager Nathan Jones is “very confident” that the club will be able to agree a contract extension with Lloyd Jones. I’m really enjoying the performances and the leadership qualities he is putting in because we always knew that was in Lloyd Jones.”
